meanings.definition: To revoke or annul a law or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The judge repeals the unfair rule.
meanings.sent2: The government repeals outdated laws regularly.
meanings.sent3: The cat repeals the 'no pets allowed' rule by sneaking into the building.
meanings.sent4: Her smile repeals any doubts about her sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The sunshine repeals the darkness of the night.

meanings.definition: The act of revoking or annulling a law or regulation.
meanings.sent1: The repeal of the law caused confusion among the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The repeal of the tax law was met with mixed reactions.
meanings.sent3: The repeal of the bedtime rule led to a night of chaos in the house.
meanings.sent4: His apology was like a repeal of all past mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The repeal of the ban brought joy to the community.
